newsitem.title: INDIA: India Congress leader wants minimum tax withdrawn.
newsitem.headline: India Congress leader wants minimum tax withdrawn.

text.p: A senior leader of India's Congress party, which gives make-or-break support to Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda's coalition, was quoted on Tuesday as saying the government must roll back a minimum corporate tax.

The Associated Chambers of Commerce and Industry (Assocham) quoted Pranab Mukherjee, a leading economic strategist of the Congress party, as saying at a seminar that the minimum alternate tax (MAT) must be withdrawn to boost savings and investment.

Finance Minister P.Chidambaram imposed in his budget last July the controversial 12.9 percent MAT on firms that in the past evaded corporate taxation by using a loophole that exempted tax payments on profits ploughed back into business.
The MAT was one of the key factors that caused a subsequent decline in Indian stock markets.

Mukherjee who has in the past held the jobs of the Finance Minister and Foreign Minister, also called for a reduction in interest rates as inflation based on wholesale prices was below 7 percent compared to a historical average of 8.5 to 9.0 percent.
